plants.name: Rhododendron spp.
plants.description: A genus of woody plants with large clusters of bell-shaped or funnel-shaped flowers, often found in temperate gardens and mountainous regions.
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere temperate regions, including North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Rhododendrons are important nectar sources for bees and many species are highly valued for their ornamental beauty.

plants.name: Ipomoea pes-caprae
plants.description: A fast-growing, sprawling vine with bright purple funnel-shaped flowers, commonly found on sandy beaches and coastal dunes.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, peak blooming in spring to summer
plants.location: Tropical coastlines worldwide, including Florida, Australia, and Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: Beach Morning Glory helps stabilize sand dunes and prevent erosion thanks to its extensive root system.

plants.name: Erythrina crista-galli
plants.description: A deciduous tree with striking bright red flowers shaped like a rooster's comb, popular in subtropical ornamental planting.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring to early summer (September to November in Southern Hemisphere, April to June in Northern when cultivated)
plants.location: Native to South America; cultivated in warm subtropical gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: The seeds of Erythrina crista-galli are toxic but have been used traditionally in some cultures for medicinal purposes.

plants.name: Lupinus perennis
plants.description: A native wildflower with vibrant spikes of pea-like flowers, important for pollinators and native butterfly species.
plants.location: Eastern North America, especially in sandy soils and open woods
plants.funFact: Wild Lupine is the host plant for the endangered Karner Blue Butterfly, providing food for its larvae.
